author: Alex Osborn
title: Xbox Live Architect Leaves Microsoft
text:
Xbox Live Architect Eric Neustadter Leaves Microsoft Share. By Alex Osborn 
After 18 years at Microsoft and over 14 years working on Xbox, Eric Neustadter has announced he's leaving the company. 
In a post on Twitter , the Xbox Live architect confirmed that today, October 23, will serve as his last day at the company. After 14.5 years working at Xbox (18.5 at MS) today is my last day. It's been an amazing ride. So Long, and Thanks for All the Gamerscore! 
â€” Eric Neustadter (e) (@thevowel) October 23, 2015 
Neustadter, who's famously known as the first person to create an Xbox Live gamertag (claiming the name "e"), played an instrumental role in shaping Xbox Live as both architect and operations manager. The reason behind his departure has not yet been revealed. 
Meanwhile, Microsoft is gearing up to release a massive system overhaul for Xbox One next month, which will revamp the dashboard and add backwards compatibility . You can read all about November's system update right here .
